frame.name: Taking_sides
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a relatively fixed positive or negative point of view towards an <fen>Issue</fen>. A <fen>Side</fen> in a debate concerning an <fen>Issue</fen> or an <fen>Action</fen> of a <fen>Side</fen> may stand in for the <fen>Issue</fen>. The <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s <fen>Degree</fen> of alignment may also be specified.
<ex>In interviews , it seems like <fex name="cog">everyone</fex> <m>is</m> <fex name="deg">completely</fex> <t>against</t> <fex name="iss">this expenditure</fex> .</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition: <def-root>The individual that holds an opinion on an <fen>Issue</fen> or Side.</def-root>

FE.name: Issue
FE.definition: <def-root>The matter, usually concerning a course of action, which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a positive or negative opinion about.</def-root>

FE.name: Side
FE.definition: <def-root>The party or individual (generally associated with a particular position on an <fen>Issue</fen>) that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has an opinion about.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> supports or opposes something.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time period during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has the indicated point of view towards the <fen>Issue</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Time">Last year</fex> she <t>opposed</t> the bill, but changed her mind after she received correspondence supporting the bill. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> is a proposition denoting a state of affairs from which the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s taking the indicated view on the <fen>Issue</fen> logically follows.
<ex>Could it be that he <t>sided</t> with them <fex name="exp">because it was the constitutionaly correct thing to do</fex>?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Action
FE.definition:
<def-root>An action taken by a <fen>Side</fen> or a view that the <fen>Side</fen> takes on an issue which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> either supports or opposes.
</def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the person or element that is taking a side. </def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the Taking_sides which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Cognizer</fen> that affect the action (reluctantly, meekly).</def-root>

FE.name: Concessive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause. </def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The location where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> takes <fen>Side</fen>s on an <fen>Issue</fen> .</def-root>
